thread.name: Adding an artifact from the Guide

ok.. i just recreated the env.. with infrahub 1.1.3.. i still see the same behavior..

Exactly

ok, i am testing by changing the parameter to `hostname` but no luck in generating the artifact..
let me test out the change of parameter.. the `CoreArtifactTarget` is to get the artifact to appear as a tab under the device yeah?
The device was also missing inheriting from CoreArtifactTarget.
That passes in the appropriate variable into the query.

https://github.com/FragmentedPacket/infrahub-artifact-test

It appears that the artifact definition needed the parameter changed from `device` to `hostname`.. at least that is what got it working for me and the repo with the files above.
All good.. looking forward to your testing and findings...
I wouldn't expect to see that error message, as I don't see anything obvious that you are doing wrongly. Let me try if I can recreate the issue here as well. Probably something for tomorrow morning
Infrahub - v1.1.2
Waht version of Infrahub are you running?
oh.. you mean infrahubctl version inside of the docker? how can i check that? and which of the containers?
my j2 template is

```
Python: 3.12.7
Python SDK: v1.5.0
```
What are your versions? `infrahubctl version`. Do you have the Jinja template as well?
No, it appears it might be an issue of actually create the artifact object in Infrahub. The CTL command executes, but doesn't save the artifact to Infrahub.
Something wrong with my query?? but it works on the CLI with the `infrahubctl` command..
Here are the log files
I have just 4 devices added.. and i have all of them in the AllDevices Group..
Could you confirm he `device` you are trying to generated an Artifact for, is present in the `AllDevices` Group ?
That would be great, at first sight this looks good though
i can share the logs with you tomorrow...

```
---
jinja2_transforms:
  - name: my-jinja2-transform # Unique name for your transform
    description: "short description" # (optional)
    query: "tags_query" # Name or ID of the GraphQLQuery
    template_path: "tags_render/tags_tpl.j2" # Path to the main Jinja2 template

  - name: interface_transform
    description: "generate interface configuration"
    query: "interface_query"
    template_path: "transformations/interface/interface_tpl.j2"

python_transforms:
  - name: tags_transform
    class_name: TagsTransform
    file_path: "tags_render/tags_transform.py"

queries:
  - name: tags_query # Name of the GraphQLQuery
    file_path: "tags_render/tags_query.gql" # Path to the main Jinja2 template

  - name: interface_query
    file_path: "transformations/interface/interface_query.gql"

artifact_definitions:
  - name: Interface_configuration
    artifact_name: "interface_configuration"
    parameters:
      device: "hostname__value"
    content_type: "text/plain"
    targets: "AllDevices"
    transformation: "interface_transform"

```
and here is the rest of my .infrahub.yml file

Can you get us the logs?
`docker logs infrahub-server-1 > server.log`
`docker logs infrahub-task-worker-1 > worker-1.log`
`docker logs infrahub-task-worker-2 > worker-2.log`

It would be good to see the schema of the NetworkInterface and Device schemanodes and the rest of the `.infrahub.yml` file as well.

when i sync the repository, i see the artifact definition.. and when i click on the generate button on top, i get a green notification below saying `Artifacts generated`  but when i go into Deployment > artifact > artifact i dont see anything..

What am i missing? I still have not created the relation between a node and a artifact.. i want to get this going successfully before i proceed to that bit..

ok, i need a bit of help with the artifacts again.. so i have a query that gets all the interface configuration based on `hostname` of a `device` passed... and i have a transformation that spits out the interface configuration.. I have tested this on the cli using the infrahub ctl command and it works.. 

I have also created a Standard Group called `AllDevices` and added all my devices to the group..

here is the artifact definition i have

```
artifact_definitions:
  - name: Interface_configuration
    artifact_name: "interface_configuration"
    parameters:
      device: "hostname__value"
    content_type: "text/plain"
    targets: "AllDevices"
    transformation: "interface_transform"
```
ok, that kinda makes sense.. i am going to continue to do what i am doing and will reachout in case i have questions.. thank you..

It's probably because you added the members to the group after you imported the repository.

You can manually trigger the artifact generation, by navigation to the artifact definition (deployment > artifact > artifact definition), click on the artifact defintion, and then on the generate button

A group is just a node that allows you to group other nodes (of any kind) together. For example a group could be `cisco_devices` to which you add all the Cisco devices. It is typically used to organise your data.

Groups can then be used in other features:
For example, Artifact definitions are tight to a group. An artifact will be generated for all the members of the group, according to the artifact definition.
the biggest miss for me is the concept of groups.. i am dont quite understand what it does..
yeah i did add the members..
Did you add objects to the TagConfigGroup?
I have created the Group now and the sync is successful.. i can see the Artifact definition in the UI.. however, it does not seem to be generating any Artifacts..

I knew i was missing something silly.. I am having a hard time understanding the concept of `Groups` i have read the documentation a few times and am still a bit confused.. are you able to help me understand it?

Hey,

Did you create the group "TagConfigGroup" in Infrahub?

my `.infrahub.yml` looks like this

```
---
artifact_definitions:
  - name: "tags_config_file"
    artifact_name: "Tags configuration file"
    parameters:
      tag: "name__value"
    content_type: "text/plain"
    targets: "TagConfigGroup"
    transformation: "my-jinja2-transform"

jinja2_transforms:
  - name: my-jinja2-transform # Unique name for your transform
    description: "short description" # (optional)
    query: "tags_query" # Name or ID of the GraphQLQuery
    template_path: "tags_render/tags_tpl.j2" # Path to the main Jinja2 template

python_transforms:

queries:
  - name: tags_query # Name of the GraphQLQuery

```

embeds.title: Creating an Artifact | Infrahub Documentation
embeds.description: This guide has the assumption that you followed the Creating a Jinja Rendered File (Transform) or Creating a Python transform guide as well as Creating a Group guide
